intro: Phagnalon bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive two-toned leaves, which are typically green on the upper surface and grayish-white on the underside. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Phagnalon bicolor is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
